p: The models for all three response variables showed that all fixed effects (sampling site, maternal line nested within sampling site, and experimental condition) were statistically significant at the p=0.05 level ( Figure 5 and Supplementary file 4). Experimental condition explained a small percentage of the variation (1.2–8.1%), as did sampling site (1.8–17.7%). Maternal line tended to explain a larger amount of variation (10.6–27.6%). However, most of the variation remained unexplained (56.6–71.5%) ( Figure 5 and Supplementary file 4). None of the three response variables showed significant variation in phenotypic plasticity across sites (p>0.50 for all maternal line/sampling site by experimental condition interactions) ( Figure 5 and Supplementary file 5).
